reviewText: CROWHAVEN FARM is yet another horror film that deserves an "official" (US) DVD release. It's a wonderfully dark, supernatural tale of witches, satanism, and creepy Puritans! Toss in an eeevil kid named Jennifer, and Hope Lange as the beleaguered heroine, and you've got a 70s TV classic!  Maggie (Lange) inherits the property of the title after her relative dies in a car "accident". Of course, we know better! Things start going south very quickly, especially when 10yo Jennifer joins the family! More "accidents" occur, and Maggie becomes increasingly convinced that she and her husband are being attacked by eeevil spirits. If you enjoy any of the great TV horror films from the 1970s, you'll love CROWHAVEN FARM! Highly recommended...
Title: N/A

reviewText: Ben and Maggie Porter (Hope Lange), through tragic default, inherit a piece of farmland. The newly owned Crowhaven Farm has peculiar, meddling, occult savvy locals, who dig into the lives of the Porters. The couples inability to conceive, draws special attention from the heads of the town and yet through another accident, they adopt a young girl who also bears bite marks, marking her as a demon child.Although it borrows from Rosemary's Baby, Crowhaven Farm, has a few disturbing scenes that will appeal to a horror fan that is into the Witch/Cult subgenre.If you have seen everything there is to see in the universe of horror and are a fan of films like Horror Hotel and Rosemary's Baby, give this a shot.
Title: N/A

reviewerName: G. H. Giroux "Eccentric Writer & World Traveler"
reviewText: I loved this old TV movie and remember watching it when I was in college. In fact, virtually all of ABC's MOTW were great, and finally they are releasing some on DVD (Gargoyles, Trilogy of Terror, The Night Stalker, Scream of the Wolf, etc.). I am genuinely happy to have CF in my collection.I enjoyed the supernatural plot as I did before, and couldn't help thinking what a handsome guy Paul Burke was (even more so with longer hair than when he was in Twelve O'clock High), and how gorgeous Hope Lange was. It was lovely to see the cast of character actors with whom I grew up.However, I was disappointed by the quality of the video, which wasn't anywhere near the caliber of the movies I mentioned above. There was real blurriness to the film, kind of like when you had a VHS version and then used another machine to make a second VHS copy. Also, there was no menu, extras, or anything: when the movie ended, the screen simply went blank. Obviously whoever created this version had no desire for basic 'extras.' When I opened the DVD case, I was startled to see that the DVD label looked like someone had printed it out at home rather than it being a professional release.I wish the company that released this took more care and respect in producing the product than they did.
summary: Good Old Movie of the Week, but ...
Title: N/A

reviewText: Enough already with these lame DVD-R releases that won't play in some DVD players. When is a company going to license the entire ABC Movie of the Week series and put it out in volumes on official DVD relases? Most all of those original ABC made for TV films were brilliant and well made and would hold up to today's viewers. So come on, someone please get with the "program" and give us those great ABC Movie Of The Week films that we remember so well from our youth, remastered and restored on official DVD's!
summary: PUT THE ABC MOVIE OF THE WEEK SERIES ON DVD!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Hope Lange stars in this "Period Piece?" from a lost era. I'm talking about 1970s movie of the week. For all the channels, on demand, instant downloads and crazy ways to deliver a movie to you, there will never be movies like this again. But this is a little pricey and honestly, who knows what you are going to get. Try Googling this title and I bet you find a much better deal. 70s Horror Rock!
summary: Great TV movie from 70s but a little pricey...
Title: N/A

reviewText: Crowhaven Farm isn't your ordinary rural property.  Location.  Location.  Location!  That and a few local yocals give this story plenty to keep you interested.  Not too long on surprises but well directed and believable.  I love a good ghost story and this one fills the bill.

reviewText: I managed to watch 30 minutes of this film and couldn't go any further because of the repetitious flashback scenes, very annoying.  I think this film would have been great when it was made but because of the quality of story lines in films these days, I tend to be biased toward newer movies.

reviewerName: Wednesday Lee Friday: writer of scarybooks "K...
reviewText: This movie is wild in a 70's Time Capsule way.  It features people you'll recognize from Twilight Zone eps--most notably The Masks and To Serve Man.  It also features hilarious infantilizing of the female lead,. Eg, telling her she probably hallucinated the strange things she'd seen, since she'd been out in the sun.  Really?  o.O  Most of all though, this is a creepy drama with some genuinely scary imagery, strong performances, and an ending you might not see coming.
summary: Fuzzy pic, but an awesome film.
Title: N/A
